document.masterDocTitle: Catalogue of the mite families Ascidae Voigts & Oudemans, Blattisociidae Garman and Melicharidae Hirschmann (Acari: Mesostigmata)

subSubSection.paragraph:
TYPE
DEPOSITORY: of
P . pygmaeus
: author’s personal collection; of
L . conviva : Istituto Sperimentale
per la Zoologia Agraria, Firenze, Italy ; of
H . hypudaei
,
J . hypudaei var. sopalit
,
T . bulbicolus
,
L . alpinus
and
L . ventritrichosus
: not stated; of
L . ( L .) innumerabilis : Istituto Sperimentale
per la Zoologia Agraria, Firenze, Italy ; of
L . conviva var. laevisternus : Istituto Sperimentale
per la Zoologia Agraria, Firenze, Italy ; of
H . ovatus
: Institute for Endemic Disease Prevention and Control, Qinghai, Xining, China .

TYPE
LOCALITY AND HABITAT : of
P . pygmaeus
: Saint Catherine's Cave, Blansko, South Moravian Region, Czech Republic , in damp places; of
L . conviva
: Java, Indonesia , on
Gryllus
sp. [Animalia: Gryllidae ]; of
H . hypudaei : Sneek
, The Netherlands ; on
Arvicola amphibius
(reported as
Paludicola amphibius
) [Animalia: Muridae ]; of
J . hypudaei var. sopalit
: Czech Republic , on sunflower [Plantae: Asteraceae ] seeds; of
T . bulbicolus
: USA , on rotten lily [Plantae: Liliaceae ] bulbs; of
L . alpinus : Val
del Botsch, Swiss National Park, Switzerland , in moss and
Sedum
mat [Plantae: Crassulaceae ] and Fuorcla Cornet Swiss National Park, Switzerland , on low growing vegetation; of
L . ( L .) innumerabilis : Firenze
, Italy , rotten leaves and fruits, and chicken excrement; of
L . ventritrichosus : Fuorcla Cornet, Swiss
National Park, Switzerland , on low growing vegetation; of
L . conviva var. laevisternus : Buitenzorg
, Java, Indonesia , on tubercles of
Ipomoea
[cited as Hypomaea ] batatas [Plantae: Convolvulaceae ]; of
H . ovatus : Huangzhong
, Qinghai, China , on
Cricetulus migratorius
[Animalia: Muridae ].

NOTE : (a)
Evans ( 1958 a: 199 )
suspected
H . hypudaei
to be a senior synonym of
Lasioseius fissuratus Berlese
; (b)
Domrow ( 1974 : 16 )
considered this species to be a senior synonym of
Garmania nesbitti Womersley
, but Halliday et al . ( 1998 : 36 ) considered them to be distinct species; that latter interpretation is accepted in this publication.
